item.title: Vanguard 表示支持埃克森董事会，但提出投资者权益问题
item.description: 先锋（Vanguard）表示，旗下基金支持埃克森公司在上周的年会上选举其提名的董事，但这家共同基金巨头表示，对该能源公司起诉气候活动人士的担忧挥之不去。【原文：Vanguard said its funds supported the election of Exxon's director nominees at its annual meeting last week, but the mutual fund giant cited lingering concerns about the energy company's lawsuit against climate activists.】

item.title: 波音公司首席执行官将于 6 月 18 日在美国参议院小组作证
item.description: 波音公司首席执行官戴夫-卡尔霍恩（Dave Calhoun）将于6月18日在美国参议院小组会议上作证，此前发生的一系列事故引起了人们对安全和质量的担忧，监管机构禁止该飞机制造商扩大其最畅销的737 MAX的产量。【原文：Boeing CEO Dave Calhoun will testify before a U.S. Senate panel on June 18 after a series of incidents raised concerns about safety and quality and regulators barred the planemaker from expanding production of its best-selling 737 MAX.】

item.title: 软银支持的在线银行 Inter 在佛罗里达州向巴西人下注
item.description: 软银支持的巴西在线贷款公司 Inter & Co 希望在美国复制其在本土市场的成功，该公司首席执行官表示，它正在佛罗里达州最大的两个城市瞄准来自拉美最大国家的游客。【原文：SoftBank-backed Brazilian online lender Inter & Co is hoping to replicate its home market success in the United States, where it is targeting visitors from Latin America's largest country in two of Florida's biggest cities, the firm's chief executive said.】

item.title: 英伟达股票市值首次达到 3 万亿美元
item.description: 本周三，英伟达（Nvidia）的股票市值首次突破 3 万亿美元，因为这家芯片制造商从华尔街重量级企业争夺人工智能技术主导权的竞争中获益匪浅。【原文：Nvidia's stock market value hit $3 trillion for the first time on Wednesday as the chipmaker benefited from a race between Wall Street's heavyweights to dominate AI technology.】

item.title: MercadoLibre 今年在巴西的投资额将超过最初预测
item.description: 拉丁美洲电子商务巨头 MercadoLibre 巴西当地市场负责人 Fernando Yunes 周三表示，由于销售额高于预期，预计今年在巴西的投资将超过最初计划的 230 亿雷亚尔（约合 43.5 亿美元）。【原文：Latin American e-commerce giant MercadoLibre expects its investments in Brazil this year to exceed the 23 billion reais ($4.35 billion) initially planned due to higher-than-expected sales, local marketplace head Fernando Yunes said on Wednesday.】

item.title: 中国太保集团向巴西风电场投资 1.47 亿美元，并启动太阳能园项目
item.description: 中国电力公司 SPIC 周三宣布投资 7.8 亿雷亚尔（1.4741 亿美元）在巴西东北部建设两个新的风电场，同时首次进军巴西太阳能领域，两个大型园区已开始运营。【原文：Chinese electricity company SPIC announced on Wednesday a 780 million reais ($147.41 million) investment in construction of two new wind farms in Northeastern Brazil, while making its debut in the country's solar sector, with two large parks beginning operations.】

item.title: 亚马逊工会与卡车司机工会结成联盟
item.description: 亚马逊工会（ALU）已同意与美国最大的工会之一--国际卡车司机兄弟会（International Brotherhood of Teamsters）建立联盟关系，这是电商巨头工会化进程加快的最新迹象。【原文：The Amazon Labor Union (ALU) has agreed to affiliate with the International Brotherhood of Teamsters, one of the largest U.S. labor unions, in the latest sign that unionization efforts are picking up at the e-commerce giant.】

item.title: 民主党人称美国计划仅部署 7 个电动汽车充电站 "可悲
item.description: 一位民主党参议员周三表示，在美国政府于 2021 年设立的一项耗资 50 亿美元的计划资助下，仅有 7 个电动汽车（EV）充电站开始运营，进展 "少得可怜"。【原文：Just seven electric-vehicle (EV) charging stations have begun operating with funding from a $5-billion U.S. government program created in 2021, marking "pathetic" progress, a Democratic senator said on Wednesday.】

item.title: 在报纸报道汽车制造商扩大召回范围后，Stellantis表示不再计划因安全气囊问题进行召回
item.description: 在《巴黎人报》（Le Parisien）报道该汽车制造商将扩大对 2009 年至 2019 年期间生产的部分雪铁龙车型的召回范围后，Stellantis 周三表示，没有计划因一家供应商的安全气囊故障而进行额外召回。【原文：Stellantis on Wednesday said no additional recalls were planned over faulty airbags from a supplier after newspaper Le Parisien reported the carmaker was set to widen recalls for some Citroen models produced between 2009 and 2019.】

item.title: 英伟达即将超越苹果，成为第二大最有价值公司
item.description: 周三，英伟达（Nvidia）股价创下历史新高，这家人工智能芯片制造商的股市估值即将突破 3 万亿美元大关，超越苹果公司成为全球第二大最有价值公司。【原文：Shares of Nvidia rallied to record highs on Wednesday, with the AI chipmaker's stock market valuation on the verge of hitting the $3 trillion mark and overtaking Apple to become the world's second most valuable company.】

item.title: 美国证券交易委员会主席詹斯勒欢迎多家国债清算所展开竞争
item.description: 美国证券交易委员会主席加里-根斯勒（Gary Gensler）周三表示，他欢迎围绕美国国债多家清算所展开的竞争，尽管他说潜在的申请者还没有正式提出申请。【原文：Gary Gensler, chair of the Securities and Exchange Commission, said on Wednesday he welcomed competition around having multiple clearing houses for U.S. Treasuries, though he said there was no formal filing from potential applicants.】

item.title: 洛克希德-马丁公司将从 Firefly Aerospace 公司购买多达 25 枚火箭发射装置
item.description: 美国国防承包商洛克希德-马丁公司（Lockheed Martin）周三表示，已与萤火虫宇航公司（Firefly Aerospace）达成购买协议，到2029年将使用其阿尔法火箭进行多达25次发射。【原文：Lockheed Martin has entered a purchase agreement with Firefly Aerospace for up to 25 launches on its Alpha rocket by 2029, the U.S. defense contractor said on Wednesday.】

item.title: 美国航空公司立即为空乘人员加薪 17
item.description: 美国航空公司（American Airlines）首席执行官罗伯特-伊索姆（Robert Isom）周三表示，美国航空公司已在新合同中为其空乘人员提供了 17% 的即时工资增长和 2024 年更高利润分配的新方案。【原文：American Airlines has offered its flights attendants immediate wage increases of 17% and a new formula for higher profit sharing in 2024 in their new contracts, CEO Robert Isom said on Wednesday.】

item.title: 工资飙升，失业率创新低，凸显俄罗斯劳动力紧缺的现状
item.description: 联邦统计局周三公布的数据显示，俄罗斯 4 月份失业率降至 2.6% 的历史最低水平，3 月份实际工资飙升，凸显了俄罗斯劳动力市场的紧张程度。【原文：Russia's unemployment rate dropped to a record-low 2.6% in April and real wages soared in March, data published by the federal statistics service showed on Wednesday, highlighting the extent of Russia's tight labour market.】

item.title: 丰田投资 2.82 亿美元扩大阿拉巴马州的生产规模
item.description: 阿拉巴马州丰田公司周三表示，它将在阿拉巴马州亨茨维尔投资 2.82 亿美元，增加新的生产线，这将创造约 350 个新的就业机会。【原文：Toyota Alabama said on Wednesday it was investing $282 million in Huntsville, Alabama to add new production lines, which will generate around 350 new jobs.】

item.title: 纽约联储官员要求债券市场为中央清算做好准备
item.description: 纽约联邦储备银行（Federal Reserve Bank of New York）的一位高级官员周三表示，现在是市场参与者为国债市场即将出台的新清算规则做好准备的时候了。【原文：A top Federal Reserve Bank of New York official said Wednesday it’s time now for market participants to get prepared for new clearing rules looming in the Treasury bond market.】

item.title: 加密货币交易所 Binance 寻求削减 130 亿美元的英国诉讼规模
item.description: 加密货币交易所 Binance 周三寻求驳回伦敦一桩价值高达 100 亿英镑（约合 128 亿美元）的诉讼案中的绝大部分诉讼请求，该诉讼案声称 Binance 与其他交易所串通将比特币中本聪愿景（Bitcoin Satoshi Vision，BSV）加密货币 "除名"。【原文：Crypto exchange Binance on Wednesday sought to throw out the vast majority of a London lawsuit worth up to 10 billion pounds ($12.8 billion) over claims it and other exchanges colluded to "delist" the Bitcoin Satoshi Vision (BSV) cryptocurrency.】

item.title: 耶伦警告人工智能在金融领域的应用将带来 "重大风险
item.description: 美国财政部长珍妮特-耶伦（Janet Yellen）将警告说，人工智能在金融领域的应用可以降低交易成本，但也存在 "重大风险"。【原文：U.S. Treasury Secretary Janet Yellen will warn that the use of artificial intelligence in finance could lower transaction costs, but carries "significant risks," according to excerpts from a speech to be delivered on Thursday.】

item.title: 供不应求，酒店高管瞄准空置写字楼
item.description: 从美国到中国，酒店高管们正在对黄金地段的空置办公楼和住宅楼进行调查，以推动供应增长，因为新建筑面临的融资挑战阻碍了最大限度满足旺盛需求的努力。【原文：Hotel executives are surveying vacant office and residential buildings in prime locations from the U.S. to China to drive supply growth as financing challenges for new construction hinder efforts to maximize buoyant demand.】

item.title: 大受欢迎的货币交易平仓震撼市场
item.description: 本周，墨西哥大选取得压倒性胜利后，该国货币大幅下跌，震撼了远在匈牙利和土耳其的外汇市场，让投资者不禁要问，大受欢迎的 "利差交易 "平仓是否会继续。【原文：A sharp drop in Mexico's currency after a landslide election result has shaken foreign exchange markets as far as Hungary and Turkey this week, leaving investors asking whether the unwinding of hugely popular "carry trades" will continue.】

item.title: 美国服务业五月份反弹
item.description: 周三公布的一项调查显示，美国服务业在经历了上个月的短暂萎缩后，5月份重新进入增长模式，一项衡量商业活动的指标创下了三年来的最大增幅。【原文：The U.S. services sector snapped back into growth mode in May after a short-lived contraction the month before, with a measure of business activity improving by the most in three years, according to a survey published Wednesday that may buttress the Federal Reserve's wariness of a shift to interest rate cuts.】

item.title: 美国上诉法院推翻证交会对私募股权和对冲基金的监督规定
item.description: 美国一家上诉法院驳回了美国证券交易委员会（Securities and Exchange Commission）旨在为投资者提供更多私募基金透明度的规定，但这个近 27 万亿美元的行业表示，该规定有可能从根本上改变其经营方式。【原文：A U.S. appeals court rejected a Securities and Exchange Commission rule intended to give investors more transparency into private funds, but which the nearly $27 trillion industry said threatened to fundamentally change how it does business.】

item.title: 特斯拉投资者罗恩-巴伦支持马斯克 560 亿美元的薪酬计划
item.description: 著名投资人罗恩-巴伦（Ron Baron）周二发表公开信，支持特斯拉首席执行官埃隆-马斯克（Elon Musk）560亿美元的薪酬方案，该方案将于下周接受股东投票。【原文：Prominent investor Ron Baron has come out in support of Tesla CEO Elon Musk's $56 billion pay package, which is up for a shareholder vote next week, according to an open letter from the Baron Capital founder on Tuesday.】

item.title: 杰克丹尼尔制造商布朗-福尔曼（Brown-Forman）因提价而实现超预期季度利润
item.description: 杰克丹尼尔威士忌制造商布朗-福尔曼（Brown-Forman）周三公布的第四季度利润超出预期，原因是其高端威士忌和龙舌兰酒的提价帮助抵消了需求的减弱，这使得该公司股价在盘前交易中上涨了 3%。【原文：Jack Daniel's maker Brown-Forman beat fourth-quarter profit expectations on Wednesday, as price hikes on its premium whiskey and tequila helped offset waning demand, sending the company's shares up 3% in premarket trading.】

item.title: ASML 因首席财务官达森对订单的评论而股价上涨
item.description: 杰富瑞（Jefferies）的一份分析报告援引首席财务官罗杰-达森（Roger Dassen）的评论称，他对未来几个季度顶级客户台积电（TSMC）可能获得订单持积极态度，此后 ASML 股价周三上涨。【原文：ASML shares rose on Wednesday after a Jefferies analyst report cited comments from CFO Roger Dassen which suggested he was positive about the possibility of orders coming through from top customer TSMC in the coming quarters.】

item.title: 沃尔玛首次向美国商店小时工发放奖金
item.description: 沃尔玛周三表示，将有史以来第一次向其美国门店的小时工（包括药店和视觉中心门店的小时工）发放奖金，此举可能会提高 70 万一线员工的工资。【原文：Walmart will, for the first time ever, pay bonuses to its U.S. hourly store workers, including those at its pharmacy and Vision Center stores, the retailer said on Wednesday, in a move that could boost wages for 700,000 front-line staff.】

item.title: 消息人士称，欧洲央行将批准希腊银行在 16 年后恢复支付股息的请求
item.description: 四位银行家周三告诉路透社，欧洲中央银行有望批准希腊银行在 16 年后恢复支付股息的请求，这是希腊银行业反弹的又一迹象。【原文：The European Central Bank is expected to approve a request by Greek banks to resume the payment of dividends after 16 years, four bankers told Reuters on Wednesday, a further sign of the sector's rebound.】

item.title: 路透社调查发现，美联储今年将从 9 月开始降息两次；但仍有一次或零次降息的风险
item.description: 路透社的一项民意调查显示，大多数预测者认为，美国联邦储备委员会将在 9 月份下调其关键利率，并在今年再下调一次。【原文：The U.S. Federal Reserve will cut its key interest rate in September and once more this year, according to a majority of forecasters in a Reuters poll that also showed a significant risk they opt for only one or none at all.】

item.title: 据《华尔街日报》报道，NBA 接近达成价值 760 亿美元的电视转播协议
item.description: 据《华尔街日报》周三援引知情人士的话报道，美国国家篮球协会即将与 NBC、迪士尼旗下的 ESPN 和亚马逊敲定单独的交易，这将在 11 年内带来约 760 亿美元的媒体收入。【原文：The National Basketball Association is close to finalizing separate deals with NBC, Disney's ESPN and Amazon that would bring in about $76 billion in media revenue over 11 years, the Wall Street Journal reported on Wednesday citing people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 美国 5 月私营部门薪资增幅低于预期 - ADP
item.description: 周三的一份报告显示，5月份美国私营企业薪资增幅低于预期，而上个月的数据被下调。【原文：U.S. private payrolls increased less than expected in May while data for the prior month was revised lower, a report showed on Wednesday.】
